utils¶

Functions

append_category(lst, category[, joiner, ...])

Helper to transform a list of strings into a string of key-value pairs with separating and surrounding fields.

authenticate([scopes, token_path, ...])

Creates a Gmail API client with the specified authorization scopes.

create_message(sender, to, subject[, ...])

Creates an email message object from text, specifying sender, recipient, and subject.

create_message_with_attachment(sender, to, ...)

Creates an email message with a given body text, sender, and recipient, and attaches files specified in a list of paths.

decode_message(message[, html_decoder])

Decodes an email message into plain HTML, optionally parsing HTML as well if an HTML2Text object is passed.

delete_label(service, label_id)

Delete a label from its ID

download_attachments(messages, download_dir)

Downloads attachments in returned emails to a specialized directory, overwriting existing files only if specified

extract_fields(gmail_service, message, ...)

Recurses through message parts until plain text part is discovered

extract_header(header[, to_extract])

Extracts metadata fields from a message object

format_print_dict(di[, subvalue_extract, ...])

Given a dict, returns a formatted sting suitable for printing its key-value pairs.

get_message(gmail_service[, userId])

Retrieve a message given a user ID and message ID

insert_args(args, extra_flag, extra_arg)

Inserts new arguments in arguments list in place

label_decode(service[, id_key])

Get a mapping of label IDs to names (the user-facing label names)

list_filters(service)

List all filters active in a user account

new_search(messages, search_args, mode)

Prompt user for a new search.

normalize_path(path)

Expand ~ and all environment variables

package_message(message)

Encodes message and places it in object suitable for API request

page_response(gmail_service[, max_emails])

Parses a response to a query for emails, iterating over each page in the response object and flattening the result as a list.

parse_emails(gmail_service, search_args, ...)

Conduct a search for emails using given parameters, collects the results, and execute associated subcommand

parse_message(gmail_service, messages)

Traverse message to extract sender, recipient, date, and text

path_exists(path)

path_writeable(path[, allow_overwrite])

Given a directory, determines whether the user has write permission.

prepare_message(message, sender, to, subject)

Fills in "to", "from", and "subject" fields of an email.message object

print_messages(messages, search_args[, await_])

Prints all recovered emails in order

print_sep([char, length])

Prints a line of underscores followed by newlines

reduce_keys(di, keys)

Retrieve a value in a nested dictionary by indexing a list of keys in order

send_message(service, message[, user_id])

Sends an email message for a given user.

set_wd_to_file(file)

Set working directory to the directory containing the current file

store_messages(messages, output[, validate, ...])

Save returned email messages to a specified path

validate_before_present(date_string, formats)

Tries to parse a date string by various formats, checking each until it finds one before the current system date.
